Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um informe noticiário apareceu na parte superior do programa de TV que estávamos assistindo.{n}A notícia era sobre como diversas partes do mundo estavam enviando avisos de chuvas, inundações e altas ondas.

Russian (RU): "Ага, как же! Они передавали, что тайфун идёт очень медленно, поэтому в худшем случае завтра весь день будет лить как сегодня. Даже небольшой непогоды будет достаточно, чтобы остановить морские суда."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Passa mesmo! Eles disseram que o tufão está se movendo lentamente, então pode continuar assim amanhã o dia todo. E mesmo uma pequena chuva é o suficiente para parar os barcos."

Indonesian (IDN): "Mimpi aja! Katanya topannya bergerak lambat, jadi akan seperti ini juga seharian besok. Dan bahkan cuaca buruk sedikit saja sudah cukup untuk menghentikan kapal."
Italian (IT): "Come no! Hanno detto che il tifone si sta muovendo lentamente, quindi il tempo potrebbe rimanere così anche per tutto domani, sai? Basta anche un po' di pioggia per cancellare le rotte dei battelli."

Do you stay home when it rains and show up late when the wind's blowing, like King Kamehameha?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ってことはぁ、いっひっひ、月曜の学校はサボれそうだなぁ〜。島生活ってのも悪くないもんだぜ！　……そういや、朱志香は登校って、毎日、船で通ってるわけだろ？　船が欠航したら学校はどうなるんだ？　カメハメハ大王並みに、雨が降ったらお休みで風が吹いたら遅刻して、か？」

Жизнь на острове начинает казаться не такой уж и плохой! ......Кстати говоря, Джессика, ты каждый день должна брать катер, чтобы добраться до школы? А что ты делаешь, когда наступает, так сказать, неплавательная погода? Остаёшься дома во время дождя и объявляешься с опозданием, когда бушует ветер, подобно королю Камехамеха?"

Yağmur yağdığında evde kalıp, rüzgar estiğinde Kral Kamehameha gibi geç mi gidiyorsun?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "If the boats don't come, I stay home. Still, it's not as good as it sounds. Most of the time, I get ordered to do private study, and they're super anal about checking it, so it's not like I can take it easy."
Steam (ST): "If the boats don't come, I stay home. Still, it's not as good as it sounds. Usually, I'm ordered to study by myself, and it's not that fun with someone standing right behind you watching everything you do."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If the boats don't come, I stay home. Still, it's not as good as it sounds. Usually, I'm ordered to study by myself, and it's not that fun with someone standing right behind you watching everything you do."
PC Japanese (JP): 「船が出なきゃ休みになるぜ。もっとも、そう甘くはねーけどな。大抵、その代わりに自習が指示されて、後でかっちりと見られるからそうそう気楽でもねーさ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「船が出なきゃ休みになるぜ。もっとも、そう甘くはねーけどな。大抵、その代わりに自習が指示されて、後でかっちりと見られるからそうそう気楽でもねーさ」
Russian (RU): "Если судна не ходят, я остаюсь дома. Но всё равно, не так это и весело, как кажется. Обычно меня заставляют учиться самостоятельно, и весёлого мало, когда у тебя за спиной кто‐то стоит и следит за тем, что ты делаешь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se o barco não vem, eu fico em casa. Apesar de que não é tão bom quanto parece. Na maior parte do tempo, eu sou obrigada a ficar estudando sozinha, e eles são super‐rígidos quanto a isso, então não é como se eu pudesse descansar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不能出航就只能休息嘞。不過，也沒像你想的那麼爽。一般老師會布置一些自習作業下來，等能去學校後還得交給老師仔細檢查，沒那麼輕鬆的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不能出航就只能休息嘞。不过，也没像你想的那么爽。一般老师会布置一些自习作业下来，等能去学校后还得交给老师仔细检查，没那么轻松的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kalau kapal nggak jalan, ya aku nggak pergi. Tapi itu nggak sebaik kedengarannya. Biasanya aku disuruh belajar sendiri, dan rasanya nggak seru sama sekali kalau ada yang berdiri di belakangmu mengawasi semua yang kamu lakukan."
Italian (IT): "Se i battelli non arrivano resto a casa. Ma non è bello come sembra. Di solito non è così divertente, dato che in cambio sono costretta a studiare per conto mio, e in seguito vengo monitorata attentamente."
Turkish (TR): "Tekneler gelmezse evde kalıyorum. Yine de göründüğü kadar iyi değil. Çoğu zaman kendi başıma çalışmam isteniyor ve kontrol konusunda çok titizler, bu yüzden rahat edemiyorum."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "During the rainy season, does the weather ever stay bad for a long time and make you miss a bunch of days in a row?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...No fim, eu acabei ficando presa a uma escola perto de casa. Afinal, eu odeio essa ilha. Eu quero poder ir viver na cidade. Uma cidade onde não importa se está chovendo ou se lanças estão caindo do céu, porque, mesmo que você esteja usando roupas casuais e sandálias, você ainda pode ir a uma loja de conveniências que fica a menos de cinco minutos..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…結果高中也變成在本地念了嘞。哎，真是受夠了這破島。真想快點去城市裡生活啊。真想搬到不管下雨還是下長槍，都只用隨便穿些什麼蹬上拖鞋，不用五分鐘就能到便利店的大都市去…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…结果高中也变成在本地念了嘞。哎，真是受够了这破岛。真想快点去城市里生活啊。真想搬到不管下雨还是下长枪，都只用随便穿些什么蹬上拖鞋，不用五分钟就能到便利店的大都市去…」
Indonesian (IDN): ...Jadi, akhirnya aku tetap di dekat rumah meskipun udah SMA. Sumpah, aku benci pulau ini. Aku cuma pengen tinggal di kota. Aku nggak peduli hujan atau tombak jatuh dari langit, yang penting bisa pindah ke kota dan pakai baju santai sama sandal... dan bisa ke minimarket dalam waktu kurang dari lima menit..."
Italian (IT): "E quindi ho finito per frequentare una scuola superiore vicino casa. Ah, sono stufa di quest'isola. Voglio subito andare a vivere in città. Costi quel che costi, ma vorrei trasferirmi in una città in cui posso vestirmi casual con i sandali, e raggiungere un minimarket in meno di cinque minuti..."
Turkish (TR): "...İşin sonunda evime yakın bir liseye gitmek zorunda kaldım. Bu adadan nefret ediyorum. Gidip bir şehirde yaşamak istiyorum. Yağmurun ve hatta mızrakların gökten düşmesinin önemli olmadığı, üzerinize gündelik kıyafetlerinizi ve sandaletlerinizi giydiğiniz sürece, hala beş dakikadan daha kısa bir sürede bir dükkana gidebileceğiniz bir şehirde..."

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe because now was a bad time slot, there weren't any interesting programs on, and we had nothing to do but languidly kill time until we were called for dinner.
Steam (ST): Maybe it was a bad time slot, because there weren't any interesting programs on, and we had nothing to do but languidly kill time until we were called for dinner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe because now was a bad time slot, there weren't any interesting programs on, and we had nothing to do but languidly kill time until we were called for dinner.
PC Japanese (JP): 時間帯がぱっとしないせいか、面白い番組もやっておらず、俺たちは夕食に呼ばれるまでの時間を気だるそうに潰すしかなかった。
Russian (RU): Возможно, из‐за того, что выпало неудачное время, по телевизору не было никаких интересных передач, и нам ничего не оставалось, кроме как лениво убивать время, ожидая, когда нас позовут на ужин.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "My stomach's been growling for a~ges! Main family dinners were always fancy as hell, every time! And didn't Gohda‐san say it was calf steak or something? Oohh, I can't wai~t!!"
Steam (ST): "My stomach's been growling for a while! I've always been a huge fan of the main family's dinners! And didn't Gohda-san say it was calf steak or something? Oohh, I can't wait!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "My stomach's been growling for a while! I've always been a huge fan of the main family's dinners! And didn't Gohda-san say it was calf steak or something? Oohh, I can't wai~t!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺はとっくにぺこぺこ〜！　本家の晩餐は毎回凝ってるしなぁ〜！　それに郷田さん、仔牛のステーキとか言ってなかったっけぇ？　う〜ん、たぁまらねぇぜ〜！！」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Meu estômago está roncando há horas! Os jantares da família principal são sempre extravagantes! O Gohda‐san não tinha dito algo sobre vitela ou algo assim? Oohh, eu mal posso esperar~!!"

Italian (IT): "Il mio stomaco stava brontolando da un bel po'! Sono sempre stato un grande fan delle cene in famiglia! E Gouda-san non aveva menzionato delle bistecche di vitello o qualcosa del genere? Oohh, non sto più nella pelle!!"
Turkish (TR): "Karnım a~sırlardır gurulduyor! Baş ailenin yemekleri her zaman çok süslü oluyor, hem de her seferinde! Ve Gohda-san bunun dana bifteği falan olduğunu söylememiş miydi? Oohh, sabırsızlanıyorum~!!"

Turkish (TR): ...Çocukların hayal bile edemeyeceği bir yükü omuzlarında taşıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, when she let herself relax, that exhaustion quickly led her into the world of sleep.
Steam (ST): That's why she only needed to let her guard down a little...before the weariness immediately dragged her into the world of sleep.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, when she let herself relax, that exhaustion quickly led Rosa into the world of sleep.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、少し気を緩めれば、その疲れはすぐにも楼座を眠りの世界へ誘ってしまうのだった。
Russian (RU): Так что стоило ей только позволить себе расслабиться, как из‐за усталости она быстро погрузилась в мир снов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, quando ela se permitiu relaxar, essa exaustão rapidamente a levou para o mundo do sono.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，只要稍稍松一口气，这股疲劳就会迅速将她引入梦乡。

Umineko Project (UP): Realizing this, Genji brought a blanket over to her.{n}When he tried to spread it over her, her eyes snapped open as though she had received an electric shock.
Steam (ST): Realizing this, Genji brought a blanket over to her. When he tried to spread it over her, her eyes snapped open as though she'd been shocked with electricity.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Realizing this, Genji brought a blanket over to her. When he tried to spread it over her, her eyes snapped open as though she had been shocked with electricity.
PC Japanese (JP): それに気付き、源次は毛布を持ってきた。それを掛けてあげようとしたところで楼座は電気に弾かれたように目を覚ます。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それに気付き、源次は毛布を持ってきた。{n}それを掛けてあげようとしたところで楼座は電気に弾かれたように目を覚ます。
Russian (RU): Увидев это, Генджи принёс ей плед.{n}Когда он попытался накрыть её, она вдруг широко распахнула глаза, как будто её ударило током.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sabendo disso, Genji levou um cobertor para ela.{n}Quando ele tentou colocá‐lo sobre ela, seus olhos se abriram como se ela tivesse recebido um choque.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 注意到她入睡的源次，拿來了毛毯。{n}正要蓋到她的身上時，樓座像觸電似的睜開了雙眼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 注意到她入睡的源次，拿来了毛毯。{n}正要盖到她的身上时，楼座像触电似的睁开了双眼。
Indonesian (IDN): Menyadari ini, Genji membawa selimut untuknya. Saat dia mencoba menutupinya dengan selimut itu, matanya terbuka lebar seolah-olah tersengat listrik.
Italian (IT): Notando tale scena, Genji le portò una coperta. Quando tentò di sistemarla, gli occhi di Rosa si spalancarono come se fosse stata colpita da una scarica elettrica.
Turkish (TR): Bunu fark eden Genji ona bir battaniye getirdi.{n}Battaniyeyi üzerine örtmeye çalıştığında, Rosa'nın gözleri elektrik çarpmış gibi birden açıldı.

Italian (IT): Anche se a Rosa sembrava di aver dormito a lungo, la scoperta del fatto che non era passato molto tempo le fece scuotere leggermente il capo...

Umineko Project (UP): ...Even though she didn't feel rested at all, the drowsiness that wrapped around her felt very deep.
Steam (ST): ...Even though she didn't feel rested at all, the drowsiness that had enveloped her must've been pretty deep.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …まったく休んだ気がしないのに、彼女を包み込んだまどろみはだいぶ深いようだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Embora ela não se sentisse descansada, a sonolência a envolvia ainda mais profundamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …明明完全沒有休息過的感覺，可包圍著她的那股睏意卻似乎相當濃厚。

Turkish (TR): ...Kendini hiç dinlenmiş hissetmese de, etrafını saran uyuşukluk çok derindi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you, I'll be fine without the blanket... I mustn't sleep at such a strange time. My sense of time has been completely thrown off. ..................The rain...has finally come down, I see."
Steam (ST): "Thank you, I'll be fine without the blanket... I mustn't sleep at such a strange time. My sense of time has been completely thrown off. ...............The rain... has finally started pouring down in earnest, hasn't it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Thank you, I'll be fine without the blanket... I mustn't sleep at such a strange time. My sense of time has been completely thrown off. ...............The rain, it really is pouring."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとう、毛布は結構よ…。変な時間に眠っちゃ駄目ね。すっかり時間の感覚が狂っちゃったわ。………………雨、とうとう降り出したのね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとう、毛布は結構よ…。変な時間に眠っちゃ駄目ね。すっかり時間の感覚がくるっちゃったわ。………………雨、とうとう降り出したのね」
Russian (RU): "Спасибо, плед мне больше не потребуется... Не хватало ещё спать в такое странное время. Мои внутренние часы совсем сбились. ...............Ливень всё же грянул, понятно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigada, eu vou ficar bem sem o cobertor... Eu não deveria dormir em uma hora dessas. Meu senso de tempo está completamente perdido.{n}..................A chuva...finalmente começou a cair."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝，不過毛毯就不用了…。不能在這種時候睡覺呢。我對時間的感覺是徹底混亂了。………………雨，到底是下起來了呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢，不过毛毯就不用了…。不能在这种时候睡觉呢。我对时间的感觉是彻底混乱了。………………雨，到底是下起来了呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Terima kasih, aku baik-baik saja tanpa selimut... Aku tak boleh tidur di waktu yang aneh begini. Indra waktuku benar-benar kacau. ...............Hujan... akhirnya benar-benar mulai turun deras, ya?"
Italian (IT): "Non mi serve una coperta, grazie... Non devo dormire in orari strani. Il mio senso del tempo è stato completamente sfasato... La pioggia... sta venendo giù a catinelle, vero?"
Turkish (TR): "Teşekkür ederim, battaniye olmadan da iyi olacağım... Böyle garip bir zamanda uyumamalıyım. Zaman algım tamamen alt üst oldu. ..................Yağmur...sonunda başladı demek."

Umineko Project (UP): Rosa finally realized that the peaceful sound that had put her to sleep was actually the rain that had started falling.
Steam (ST): Rosa finally realized that the peaceful sound that had put her to sleep was actually the rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座はようやく、自分をまどろみに深く誘った静寂の音の正体が、いよいよ降り始めた雨であることを知る。
Russian (RU): Роза наконец поняла, что мирный звук, из‐за которого она заснула, в действительности был дождём, который вовсю начал лить к этому времени.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa finalmente percebeu que o sereno som que havia posto ela para dormir era, na verdade, o som da chuva que começava a cair.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座終於發現把自己深深引入小憩中的那種靜寂之聲，其實正是終於開始下起的大雨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座终于发现把自己深深引入小憩中的那种静寂之声，其实正是终于开始下起的大雨。

Italian (IT): Alla fine, Rosa comprese che il suono calmo che l'aveva fatta addormentare profondamente era in realtà la pioggia che aveva finalmente iniziato a cadere.
Turkish (TR): Rosa sonunda onu uyutan huzurlu sesin aslında yağmaya başlayan yağmur olduğunu fark etti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "The wind is blowing hard, too. ...Perhaps the typhoon is finally upon us?"
Steam (ST): "The wind's blowing hard too. ...I wonder if the typhoon's finally here."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The wind is also blowing hard. ...I wonder if it's finally the typhoon?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「風もだいぶ出ているようね。…いよいよ台風なのかしら」

Steam (ST): "......That's what they said on TV. The typhoon is moving slowly, so they think it will be like this all day tomorrow."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......That's what they said on TV. The typhoon is moving slowly, so they think it'll be like this all day tomorrow."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……そのように、テレビでは申しております。遅い台風だそうで、明日いっぱいはこんな調子だそうです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そのように、テレビでは申しております。遅い台風だそうで、明日いっぱいはこんな調子だそうです」
Russian (RU): "......По телевизору сказали, что именно так. Поскольку тайфун передвигается медленно, передавали, что завтра весь день будет такая же погода."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa

Steam (ST): "Really...? .........So, our last chance to see that wonderful rose garden must already have passed by."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Really...? .........That wonderful rose garden, that must have been my last chance to see it."

Steam (ST): From the window, what she could see of the rose garden was completely blurred by the wind and the rain.

Umineko Project (UP): Rosa knew her daughter's nature well.{n}And a chill ran up her back.
Steam (ST): Rosa knew her daughter's nature well. So a chill ran down her spine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rosa knew her daughter's nature well. She had always known.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は我が子の性分をよく知っている。そしてぞっとする。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 楼座は我が子の性分をよく知っている。{n}そしてぞっとする。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa conhecia bem a natureza de sua filha.{n}E se levantou rapidamente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座對自己孩子的性格了如指掌。{n}不禁打了個寒顫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座对自己孩子的性格了如指掌。{n}不禁打了个寒颤。

Umineko Project (UP): Maria was stupidly straightforward, to the point that "stupidly" could be repeated seven times, ......and if she was ordered to find something that didn't exist, she would look forever and ever.
Steam (ST): Maria was stubbornly honest, ......and if she was ordered to find something that didn't exist, she would look forever and ever.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria was stubbornly honest, ......and if she was ordered to find something that didn't exist, she would look forever and ever.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は馬鹿が七つ付くほどの正直だから、……ないものを探していなさいと命じたら、ずっとずっと探し続けている。
Russian (RU): Мария была до упрямого честна, и если ей приказали искать нечто, чего не существовало, то она продолжала бы искать до последнего.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Maria era estúpida o suficiente ao ponto de que poderia ser "estúpida" mais sete vezes, ......que se ela fosse ordenada a procurar algo que não existe, ela iria continuar procurando para sempre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞的死心眼，可以在前面加七個超字。……若是叫她去找沒有的東西，那她會永遠地那麼找下去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚的死心眼，可以在前面加七个超字。……若是叫她去找没有的东西，那她会永远地那么找下去。

Italian (IT): L'onestà di Maria era talmente grande da rasentare la stupidità... e se le fosse stato ordinato di cercare qualcosa che non c'era, avrebbe continuato a cercare all'infinito...
Turkish (TR): Maria aptalca açık sözlüydü, öyle ki "aptalca" kelimesi yedi kez tekrarlanabilirdi, ......ve eğer var olmayan bir şeyi bulması istenseydi, sonsuza dek arardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Even if rain was pouring down...!!
Steam (ST): ......Even in pouring rain...!!

Turkish (TR): ......Yağmur yağıyor olsa bile...!!

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "......No. The cousins left earlier, so Maria was alone...! Unless someone told her to stop, she would stay there even if spears fell down from the skies! Without even opening an umbrella!! .........Aaaah, what have I done, losing control of my emotions!!"
Steam (ST): "......No. The cousins left before I did, so Maria was alone...! Unless someone told her to stop, she'd stay there even if it started raining spears! Without even opening an umbrella!! .........Aaah, how could I have lost control of my emotions and done such a thing?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......That's wrong. The cousins left earlier, so Maria was alone...! Unless someone told her to stop, she would stay there even if spears fell down from the skies! Without even opening an umbrella!! .........AAaah, what have I done, losing control of my emotions!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……違うわ。いとこの子たちは先に行ってしまったから、あそこには真里亞ひとり…！　あの子は、誰かにもう止めろと言われない限り、例え槍が降ってこようとあそこに居続けるわ！　傘もささずに！！　………ああぁッ、私は感情に任せて何てことをッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……違うわ。いとこの子たちは先に行ってしまったから、あそこには真里亞ひとり…！　あの子は、誰かにもう止めろと言われない限り、たとえ槍が降ってこようとあそこに居続けるわ！　傘もささずに！！　………ああぁッ、私は感情に任せて何てことをッ！！」
Russian (RU): "......Так не должно быть. Остальные дети ушли ещё раньше, а значит, Мария осталась одна!.. Если кто‐нибудь не сказал ей прекратить то дело, она бы осталась там, даже если бы с неба падали копья! Даже не открыв зонтик!!! .........А‐а‐а‐ах, что же я натворила в сердцах!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Não. Os primos saíram antes, então a Maria ficou sozinha...! Ao menos que alguém a mandasse parar, ela continuaria lá mesmo que lanças estivessem caindo do céu! Sem nem mesmo abrir o guarda‐chuva!! .........Aaaah, o que eu fiz, perdendo o controle das minhas emoções?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……不對。堂兄妹們都先走了，那邊就只有真里亞一個人…！那孩子，要是沒人阻止她，哪怕是下尖槍也會一直待在那裡的！連傘都不撐！！………啊啊，我任由自己感情用事都做了些什麼啊！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……不对。堂兄妹们都先走了，那边就只有真里亚一个人…！那孩子，要是没人阻止她，哪怕是下尖枪也会一直待在那里的！连伞都不撑！！………啊啊，我任由自己感情用事都做了些什么啊！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Tidak. Para sepupu pergi duluan sebelumku, jadi Maria sendirian...! Kalau tidak ada yang menyuruhnya berhenti, dia akan tetap di sana meski hujan tombak sekalipun! Bahkan tanpa membuka payung!! .........Aaah, kenapa aku sampai kehilangan kendali dan melakukan hal seperti itu?!!"
Italian (IT): "...No. I cugini se n'erano andati via prima, quindi Maria era lì da sola...! Rimarrà lì anche se dovessero piovere lance dal cielo, finché qualcuno non dirà a mia figlia di fermarsi! Senza neanche aprire un ombrello...!! Aaah, come ho potuto lasciarmi prendere dalle emozioni!!"
Turkish (TR): "......Hayır. Kuzenleri erken ayrıldıkları için Maria yalnızdı...! Biri ona durmasını söylemediği sürece, gökten mızraklar yağsa bile orada kalırdı! Bir şemsiye bile açmadan!! .........Aaaah, ne yaptım ben, duygularımın kontrolünü kaybettim!!"

Umineko Project (UP): As her mother, she had known about Maria's foolish straightforwardness better than anyone, yet she had once again lost control of her emotions, and done such a horrible thing...!!
Steam (ST): Even though she'd known about Maria's simple honesty better than anyone, she'd once again lost control of her emotions and done something terrible!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though she had known about that simple honesty better than anyone, she had once again lost control of her emotions and done such a horrible thing!!
PC Japanese (JP): その愚直さを母である自分が一番知っていながら、自分はまた一時の感情に任せて何てひどいことをッ…！！
Russian (RU): Хотя она и знала об этой простой честности лучше остальных, она не раз теряла контроль над своими эмоциями и тем самым допускала такие ужасные случаи!!!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como mãe, ela sabia da estupidez de Maria melhor do que ninguém e, ainda assim, mais uma vez ela perdeu o controle sobre suas emoções e acabou fazendo algo horrível...!!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的倔脾氣，身為母親的自己是最清楚的。可自己竟還是被一時的衝動所驅使，做出了如此過分之事…！！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的倔脾气，身为母亲的自己是最清楚的。可自己竟还是被一时的冲动所驱使，做出了如此过分之事…！！
Indonesian (IDN): Padahal dia lebih tahu dari siapa pun betapa jujurnya Maria, tapi dia kembali kehilangan kendali atas emosinya dan melakukan sesuatu yang mengerikan!!
Italian (IT): Come ho potuto lasciarmi di nuovo prendere dalle emozioni per un attimo, ed essere così crudele con Maria, nonostante conosca la sua sincerità smodata meglio di chiunque altro!!
Turkish (TR): Annesi olarak, Maria'nın aptalca açık sözlülüğünü herkesten daha iyi biliyordu, ancak bir kez daha duygularının kontrolünü kaybetti ve böyle korkunç bir şey yaptı...!

Indonesian (IDN): [=ST]
Italian (IT): [=UP]
Turkish (TR): "Mariaaaaaaa!!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Rosa pushed Genji away and ran down the hallway.
Steam (ST): Rosa pushed Genji away and ran down the hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座は源次の肩を弾き飛ばしながら、廊下を駆け出していった。
Russian (RU): Роза оттолкнула Генджи и побежала по коридору.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Rosa empurrou Genji e saiu correndo pelo corredor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 樓座撞開源次的肩膀，朝著走廊飛奔而去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 楼座撞开源次的肩膀，朝着走廊飞奔而去。
Indonesian (IDN): Rosa mendorong Genji dan berlari menyusuri lorong.
Italian (IT): Rosa spinse via Genji, e corse giù per il corridoio.
Turkish (TR): Rosa Genji'yi itti ve koridorda koşmaya başladı.

Umineko Project (UP): The outside really looked like a typhoon, and was pouring down magnificently.
Steam (ST): The outside really looked like a typhoon, and the rain was pouring down spectacularly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The outside really looked like a typhoon, and was pouring down magnificently.
PC Japanese (JP): 表は実に台風らしい、豪快な降りになっていた。
Russian (RU): Снаружи, похоже, действительно был тайфун, и ливень стоял сплошной стеной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Lá fora parecia estar passando um tufão, e a chuva caía de forma magnífica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面已完全是台風天氣，下著傾盆大雨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面已完全是台风天气，下着倾盆大雨。
Indonesian (IDN): Di luar benar-benar terlihat seperti badai, dan hujan turun dengan sangat deras.
Italian (IT): Sembrava ci fosse davvero un tifone lì fuori, e pioveva senza sosta.
Turkish (TR): Dışarısı gerçekten bir tayfuna benziyordu ve muhteşem bir şekilde yağıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe because of some figure of the terrain, the winds were not as strong as a typhoon, so an umbrella wouldn't be torn out of one's hands.
Steam (ST): Maybe because of some aspect of the terrain, the winds weren't typhoon-class, so an umbrella wouldn't be torn out of one's hands.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe because of some figure of the terrain, the winds were not as strong as a typhoon, so an umbrella wouldn't be torn out of one's hands.
PC Japanese (JP): 地形的なものなのか、台風というほどの強風はなく、傘が風に奪われるほどのものではないようだ。
Russian (RU): Возможно, из‐за какой‐то фигуры среди ландшафта ветер был не так силён, как тайфун, и поэтому не рвал зонтики из рук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez pela forma do terreno, o vento não parecia tão forte como o de um tufão, então o guarda‐chuva não iria sair voando de sua mão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不知道是不是因為地形，倒沒有如台風般的強風，傘還不至於被風奪走。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不知道是不是因为地形，倒没有如台风般的强风，伞还不至于被风夺走。
Indonesian (IDN): Mungkin karena bentuk dataran, anginnya tidak sekelas topan, jadi payung tidak sampai terlepas dari tangan.
Italian (IT): I venti non erano forti come quelli di un tifone, forse per via della posizione geografica, e non erano capaci di portarsi via un ombrello.
Turkish (TR): Belki de arazinin yapısından dolayı rüzgâr tayfun kadar güçlü değildi, bu yüzden şemsiye insanın elinden uçup gitmiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Even so, it was enough to call it a storm.{n}There was no time to admire the roses being soaked by the rain.
Steam (ST): Even so, it certainly was a windy rain. There was no time to admire the roses being drenched.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even so, it sure was a windy rain. There was no time to admire the roses being soaked by the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): もっとも、それでも充分に風雨と呼べるものだ。のんびりと雨に濡れる薔薇を愛でている余裕はないだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もっとも、それでも充分に風雨と呼べるものだ。{n}のんびりと雨に濡れる薔薇を愛でている余裕はないだろう。
Russian (RU): Но даже так, это был очень ветреный дождь.{n}Сейчас было не время любоваться розами, пропитанными дождём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo assim, era o suficiente para se chamar de tempestade.{n}Não havia tempo para admirar as rosas encharcadas pela chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 儘管如此，還是足以稱之為大風大雨的。{n}根本就沒有那個閑情雅致，去悠閑地欣賞被打濕的玫瑰了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管如此，还是足以称之为大风大雨的。{n}根本就没有那个闲情雅致，去悠闲地欣赏被打湿的玫瑰了吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Tapi tetap saja, hujannya disertai angin yang cukup kencang. Tak ada waktu untuk mengagumi mawar yang basah kuyup.
Italian (IT): Nonostante ciò, c'era senza dubbio una tempesta. Non c'era tempo per ammirare con calma le rose che venivano inzuppate dalla pioggia.
Turkish (TR): Yine de fırtına demek için yeterliydi.{n}Yağmurun ıslattığı gülleri hayranlıkla seyredecek zaman yoktu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Anyway, I'm getting pretty worried about Maria. .........You don't think she's still rebelliously searching for that rose alone, do you?"
Steam (ST): "Anyway, I'm getting pretty worried about Maria. .........You don't think she's still rebelliously searching for that rose alone, do you?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Anyway, I'm getting pretty worried about Maria. .........You don't think that she's still rebelliously searching for that rose alone, do you?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「とりあえず今は真里亞が気になるぜ。………まさかあの後も、ずっとひとりでヘソ曲げて、あそこで薔薇探しをしてるなんてことはないよな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「とりあえず今は真里亞が気になるぜ。………まさかあの後も、ずっとひとりでヘソ曲げて、あそこで薔薇探しをしてるなんてことはないよな」
Russian (RU): "В любом случае, я очень волнуюсь за Марию. .........Как думаете, продолжает ли она до сих пор упрямо искать ту розу в одиночку, а?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De qualquer forma, eu estou ficando preocupado com a Maria. .........Vocês não acham que ela está procurando pela rosa sozinha, acham?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「總之現在我最擔心真里亞。………她總不會等我們走了之後，還一直一個人在那鬧著脾氣找玫瑰吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「总之现在我最担心真里亚。………她总不会等我们走了之后，还一直一个人在那闹着脾气找玫瑰吧。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Pokoknya, aku benar-benar khawatir pada Maria. .........Kau tak berpikir dia masih keras kepala mencari mawar itu sendirian, kan?"
Italian (IT): "Comunque sono preoccupato per Maria... Non penserete mica che si sia ancora accanita a cercare quella rosa da sola, vero?"
Turkish (TR): "Her neyse, Maria için oldukça endişelenmeye başladım. .........Hâlâ asi bir şekilde o gülü tek başına aradığını düşünmüyorsunuz, değil mi?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "...I wonder. Surely not with this much rain......is what I'd like to think, but Maria‐chan is sometimes really stubborn and foolishly simple."
Steam (ST): "...I wonder. Surely she wouldn't do it in this rain... or at least, I wish I could believe that, but Maria-chan sometimes gets really stubborn and intensely straightforward."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...I wonder. After all, in this rain,......well I wish I could say differently, but Maria-chan is sometimes really stubborn and too honest."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…そうだね。さすがにこの雨じゃ、……と思いたいところだけど、真里亞ちゃんはたまにすごく頑固で、ものすごく愚直な時がある。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…そうだね。さすがにこの雨じゃ、……と思いたいところだけど、真里亞ちゃんはたまにすごく頑固で、ものすごく愚直な時がある」
Russian (RU): "...Кто знает. Ведь там льёт как из ведра... В общем, хотел бы я сказать по‐другому, но Мария‐чан иногда действительно бывает слишком упряма и простодушна."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Não sei dizer. Certamente não com toda essa chuva......é o que eu gostaria de pensar, mas muitas vezes a Maria‐chan é realmente teimosa e inocentemente tola."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…是啊。畢竟下著這麼大的雨，……雖然我是想這麼認為，不過小真里亞有時會非常頑固，非常死心眼呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…是啊。毕竟下着这么大的雨，……虽然我是想这么认为，不过小真里亚有时会非常顽固，非常死心眼呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Entahlah. Seharusnya dia tidak akan melakukannya di hujan begini... atau setidaknya, aku ingin percaya itu, tapi Maria-chan kadang bisa sangat keras kepala dan terlalu lurus."
Italian (IT): "...Chissà. Con questa pioggia vorrei poter dire di no... Mi piacerebbe pensarlo, ma Maria-chan sa essere molto testarda, e a volte è troppo schietta."
Turkish (TR): "...Emin değilim. Bu kadar yağmur yağarken aramıyordur......düşünmek istediğim bu, ama Maria-chan bazen gerçekten inatçı ve aptalca basit."

Umineko Project (UP): We hadn't worried much, thinking that Auntie Rosa had taken her back to the mansion.
Steam (ST): We hadn't worried much, thinking that Aunt Rosa had taken her back to the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We hadn't worried much, thinking that Rosa oba-san had taken her back to the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 楼座叔母さんが屋敷に連れて行ったんだろうと思い、深く気に留めなかった。
Russian (RU): Мы особо не волновались, полагая, что тётя Роза забрала её в особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós não nos preocupamos muito, pensando que a tia Rosa havia levado ela de volta para a mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 本以為樓座姑母帶她回到了大屋，所以沒怎麼把這事放在心上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 本以为楼座姑母带她回到了大屋，所以没怎么把这事放在心上。
Indonesian (IDN): Kami awalnya tidak terlalu khawatir, berpikir bahwa Bibi Rosa sudah membawanya kembali ke mansion.
Italian (IT): Dato che credevamo che zia Rosa l'avrebbe riportata alla villa, non ci facemmo tanta attenzione...
Turkish (TR): Rosa Teyze'nin onu malikaneye geri götürdüğünü düşünerek fazla endişelenmemiştik.

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, it was concerning that Kanon‐kun had thought that Maria was here when he came from the mansion to call us.
Steam (ST): ...However, when Kanon-kun had come from the mansion to call us and thought Maria was here, we got a little worried.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...However, when Kanon-kun had come from the mansion to call us and thought that Maria was here, we got a little worried.
PC Japanese (JP): …だが、俺たちを呼びに、屋敷からやって来た嘉音くんが、こっちに真里亞がいると思っていたという点が気になる。
Russian (RU): ...Однако когда Канон‐кун пришёл из особняка, чтобы позвать нас, полагая, что Мария с нами, мы начали немного беспокоиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No entanto, era preocupante que o Kanon‐kun tivesse pensado que a Maria estava aqui quando ele veio nos chamar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不過，從大屋過來叫我們去吃飯的嘉音君卻以為真里亞在我們這裡，這使我擔起了心來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不过，从大屋过来叫我们去吃饭的嘉音君却以为真里亚在我们这里，这使我担起了心来。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Namun, ketika Kanon-kun datang dari mansion untuk memanggil kami dan mengira Maria ada di sini, kami jadi sedikit cemas.
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, nel momento in cui Kanon-kun, venuto dalla villa, ci chiamò con la convinzione che Maria fosse qui, ci impensierimmo.
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak Kanon-kun'un bizi aramak için malikaneden geldiğinde Maria'nın burada olduğunu düşünmüş olması endişe vericiydi.

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I did not see her in the mansion, so I had assumed that she was here. Since Rosa‐sama was taking a nap..."
Steam (ST): ".........I did not see her in the mansion, so I was sure she was here. After all, Rosa-sama was taking a nap..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I did not see her in the mansion, so I was sure that she was here. Since Rosa-sama was taking a nap..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………お屋敷ではお見掛けしませんでしたので、てっきりこちらにおられるとばかり。楼座さまは仮眠を取られておいででしたので…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………お屋敷ではお見掛けしませんでしたので、てっきりこちらにおられるとばかり。楼座さまは仮眠を取られておいででしたので…」
Russian (RU): ".........Я не видел её в особняке, поэтому был уверен, что она здесь. Поскольку Роза‐сама прилегла отдохнуть..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu não a vi na mansão, então supus que ela estava aqui. Como a Rosa‐sama estava tirando um cochilo..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我沒在大屋裡見到小姐，還以為她一定在這裡。因為樓座夫人剛剛也正在小睡…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我没在大屋里见到小姐，还以为她一定在这里。因为楼座夫人刚刚也正在小睡…」
Indonesian (IDN): ".........Saya tidak melihatnya di mansion, jadi saya yakin dia ada di sini. Lagipula, Nyonya Rosa sedang tertidur..."
Italian (IT): "...Non l'ho incrociata alla villa, per cui ero sicuro che fosse qui. La signora Rosa si stava riposando, perciò..."
Turkish (TR): ".........Onu malikanede görmediğim için burada olduğunu varsaymıştım. Rosa-sama uyukladığı için..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "You didn't see her on your way over here?"
Steam (ST): "You didn't see her on your way over here?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「ここに来る途中に、見掛けなかったのかよ？」
Russian (RU): "Ты не видел её, пока добирался сюда?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você não a viu no seu caminho para cá?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在來這兒的路上沒有看見她嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在来这儿的路上没有看见她吗？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kau tidak melihatnya di jalan saat ke sini?"
Italian (IT): "Non l'hai vista mentre stavi venendo qui?"
Turkish (TR): "Buraya gelirken onu görmedin mi?"

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): ".........My apologies. I opened my umbrella and ran as fast as I could, so I did not pay much attention."
Steam (ST): ".........My apologies. I opened my umbrella and ran as fast as I could, so I did not pay much attention."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………申し訳ございません。傘をさし、急ぎ駆け抜けたもので、そこまでの注意を払いませんでした。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………申し訳ございません。傘をさし、急ぎ駆け抜けたもので、そこまでの注意を払いませんでした」
Russian (RU): ".........Мои извинения. Я открыл свой зонт и побежал так быстро, как мог, поэтому не обращал особого внимания на своё окружение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Minhas desculpas. Eu abri meu guarda‐chuva e corri o mais rápido que pude, então não prestei muita atenção."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………非常抱歉。因為我撐著傘跑得很快，沒怎麼留意。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………非常抱歉。因为我撑着伞跑得很快，没怎么留意。」
Indonesian (IDN): ".........Maafkan saya. Saya membuka payung dan berlari secepat yang saya bisa, jadi saya tidak terlalu memperhatikan."
Italian (IT): "...Le mie umili scuse. Ho aperto il mio ombrello e sono corso più veloce che potevo, quindi non ho prestato molta attenzione."
Turkish (TR): ".........Özür dilerim. Şemsiyemi açtım ve olabildiğince hızlı koştum, bu yüzden fazla dikkat etmedim."

Umineko Project (UP): If he had cut through the rose garden on the shortest line between the mansion and the guesthouse, then he would have missed the place where Maria had been looking for her rose by a little.
Steam (ST): If he had cut through the rose garden, taking the shortest line between the mansion and the guesthouse, then he would've just barely missed the place where Maria had been looking for her rose.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): お屋敷とゲストハウスを最短距離で結んで薔薇庭園を突っ切ると、そこは真里亞が薔薇を探していた場所とは少しずれる。
Russian (RU): Если он миновал розарий по кратчайшему пути от особняка до домика для гостей, тогда он мог немного пропустить то место, где Мария искала свою розу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ele tivesse atravessado o jardim de rosas pelo caminho mais curto entre a mansão e a casa de hóspedes, ele não passaria pelo lugar que Maria estava procurando pela sua rosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從大屋到賓館的最短路線，需要橫穿過玫瑰庭園，而那裡是稍稍有些偏離真里亞尋找玫瑰的地方的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从大屋到宾馆的最短路线，需要横穿过玫瑰庭园，而那里是稍稍有些偏离真里亚寻找玫瑰的地方的。
Indonesian (IDN): Kalau dia memotong lewat taman mawar, mengambil jalur terpendek antara mansion dan rumah tamu, dia pasti hampir saja melewatkan tempat di mana Maria sedang mencari mawarnya.
Italian (IT): Nel caso avesse tagliato lungo il roseto per la via più breve tra la villa e la dépendance, avrebbe mancato di poco il posto dove Maria stava cercando la sua rosa.
Turkish (TR): Malikane ve konukevi arasındaki en kısa yoldan gül bahçesinden geçseydi, Maria'nın gülünü aradığı yeri küçük bir farkla kaçırmış olacaktı.

Umineko Project (UP): And it was raining this hard, too.{n}There was a good chance that Kanon‐kun had failed to notice her.
Steam (ST): And it was raining this hard, too. It certainly would've been possible for Kanon-kun to fail to notice her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And it was raining this hard, too. There was a good chance that Kanon-kun had failed to notice her.
PC Japanese (JP): 増してやこの雨だ。嘉音くんが気付かなかった可能性は充分にある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 増してやこの雨だ。{n}嘉音くんが気付かなかった可能性は充分にある。
Russian (RU): И слишком уж сильно зарядил этот дождь.{n}Поэтому, вероятнее всего, Канон‐кун просто не смог её увидеть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E ainda está chovendo muito forte.{n}Havia uma boa chance do Kanon‐kun ter falhado em percebê‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 更何況下著這麼大的雨。{n}嘉音君完全有可能注意不到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 更何况下着这么大的雨。{n}嘉音君完全有可能注意不到。
Indonesian (IDN): Dan hujannya sudah sangat deras. Tidak aneh kalau Kanon-kun tidak menyadarinya.
Italian (IT): E inoltre stava anche piovendo. C'era una buona probabilità che Kanon-kun non l'avesse notata.
Turkish (TR): Üstelik bu şiddetli yağmur yağıyordu.{n}Kanon-kun'un onu fark etmemiş olma ihtimali yüksekti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Enough debating around here, it'd be faster to just check it out directly. ......Aniki, you up for a little race?"
Steam (ST): "Instead of arguing around here, it'd be faster to just check it out directly. ......Aniki, why don't we race over there?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Enough arguing around here, it'd be faster to just check it out directly.......Aniki, why don't we race over there?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ここで議論するより、直接確かめる方が早ぇさ。……兄貴、ちょいと駆けっこと行こうじゃねぇかよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ここで議論するより、直接確かめる方が早ぇさ。……兄貴、ちょいと駆けっこと行こうじゃねぇかよ」
Russian (RU): "Хватит уже трепаться, быстрее будет самим это выяснить. ......Аники, почему бы нам вместе не пробежаться туда?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Chega de ficarmos pensando aqui, é muito mais rápido irmos lá checar. ......Aniki, pronto pra uma pequena corrida?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「與其在這裡討論，不如直接過去找來得快。……大哥，要不要來比比賽跑啊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「与其在这里讨论，不如直接过去找来得快。……大哥，要不要来比比赛跑啊？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Daripada berdebat di sini, lebih cepat kalau langsung dicek. ......Aniki, mau balapan ke sana?"
Italian (IT): "Invece di stare qui a discutere, faremmo prima a controllare di persona...Fratellone, perché non facciamo una gara?"
Turkish (TR): "Bu kadar tartışma yeter, doğrudan kontrol etmek daha hızlı olur. ......Aniki, küçük bir yarışa var mısın?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "So you think that you can beat me now that you've had six years to grow? Alright, let's find out. ............Let's go!!"
Steam (ST): "Oh, do you think you can beat me now that you've been growing for six years? Okay, let's settle this. ............Go!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Do you plan on beating me now that you've been growing for six years? Alright, let's see who wins.............Let's go!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「６年成長したから、僕に勝てるつもりかい？　よし、決着を付けようじゃないか。…………行こう！！」
Russian (RU): "Ты намереваешься победить меня теперь, после того, как вымахал за эти шесть лет? Ну ладно, давай посмотрим, чья возьмёт. ............Побежали!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então você pensa que pode me derrotar agora só porque cresceu nos últimos seis anos? Certo, vamos descobrir. ............Vamos!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「以為成長了六年，就可以贏過我嗎？好啊，就讓我們決一勝負吧。…………我們走！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「以为成长了六年，就可以赢过我吗？好啊，就让我们决一胜负吧。…………我们走！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Oh, apa kau pikir kau bisa mengalahkanku sekarang setelah enam tahun? Baiklah, ayo kita selesaikan ini. ............Ayo!!"
Italian (IT): "Pensi di portermi battere ora che sei cresciuto di sei anni? Va bene, vediamo chi vincerà... Andiamo!!"
Turkish (TR): "Büyümek için altı yılın olduğundan beni yenebileceğini mi düşünüyorsun? Pekala, hadi öğrenelim. ............Haydi gidelim!!"

Umineko Project (UP): George‐aniki and I flew out into the rain.{n}Jessica and Kanon‐kun followed us.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): George-aniki and I flew out into the rain. Jessica and Kanon-kun followed us.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我和让治大哥飞奔进大雨之中。{n}朱志香和嘉音君也追在我们身后。

Turkish (TR): Ben ve George-aniki yağmurun içine fırladık.{n}Jessica ve Kanon-kun bizi takip etti.

Umineko Project (UP): ............Six years ago, Maria had been three years old.{n}She had been a cute and pure kid who would just accept whatever anyone said.
Steam (ST): ............Six years ago, Maria had been three years old. She was a cute and pure kid who'd just accept whatever anyone said.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............Six years ago, Maria had been three years old. She had been a cute and pure kid who would just accept whatever anyone said.
PC Japanese (JP): …………６年前の真里亞は３歳だった。言われたことは何でもかんでも鵜呑みにする無垢な可愛いヤツだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …………６年前の真里亞は３歳だった。{n}言われたことは何でもかんでも鵜呑みにする無垢な可愛いヤツだった。
Russian (RU): ............Шесть лет назад Марии было три года.{n}Она была милым и честным ребёнком, которая слушалась всего, что ей говорили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Seis anos atrás, a Maria tinha apenas três anos.{n}Ela era uma criança fofa e pura que aceitava qualquer coisa que os outros dissessem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………六年前真里亞三歲。{n}那時的她，是個不管跟她說什麼都會盲目相信，純真無邪的可愛孩子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………六年前真里亚三岁。{n}那时的她，是个不管跟她说什么都会盲目相信，纯真无邪的可爱孩子。

Turkish (TR): ............Altı yıl önce, Maria üç yaşındaydı.{n}Kim ne derse desin kabul eden sevimli ve saf bir çocuktu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...But six years had passed since then!{n}She was nine now, and experiencing the good and bad parts of life should have taught her something.
Steam (ST): ...But six years have passed since then! She's nine now, and experiencing the ups and downs of life should've taught her something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...But six years had passed since then! She was nine now, and experiencing the good and bad parts of life should have taught her something.
PC Japanese (JP): …しかしあれから６年経ってるんだぞ！９歳にもなりゃ、良いことも悪いことも経験して普通はスレる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …しかしあれから６年経ってるんだぞ！{n}９歳にもなりゃ、良いことも悪いことも経験して普通はスレる。

Chinese Simplified (CN): …可是从那时到现在已经六年了！{n}到了九岁，体验过各种好事坏事一般来说是会变得挺机灵了。

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that some caring person had brought her an umbrella.{n}A normal girl would look for shelter once it started raining, but there was no way Maria's stubbornness would be broken by something like that.
Steam (ST): Some caring person must have brought her an umbrella. A normal kid would look for shelter once it started raining, but Maria was too stubborn to give up so easily.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that some caring person had somehow brought her an umbrella. A normal girl would look for shelter once it started raining, but there was no way that stubborn Maria would lose heart and do something like that.
PC Japanese (JP): どうやら、親切な人が傘を持ってきてくれたらしい。普通の子なら、雨が降れば雨宿りを考えるだろうが、頑固な真里亞はそれくらいのことでは挫けない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): どうやら、親切な人が傘を持ってきてくれたらしい。{n}普通の子なら、雨が降れば雨宿りを考えるだろうが、頑固な真里亞はそれくらいのことでは挫けない。
Russian (RU): Похоже, что кто‐то заботливый догадался принести ей зонтик.{n}Обычная девочка стала бы искать где укрыться, как только пошёл дождь, но ничто не могло сломить упрямство Марии, чтобы она поступила подобным образом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que alguma pessoa preocupada trouxe um guarda‐chuva para ela.{n}Uma garota normal iria procurar por um abrigo quando começasse a chover, mas a teimosia da Maria não seria interrompida por algo assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看來，似乎是有某位好心人拿了把傘給她。{n}一般的小孩若是碰到下雨，多半都會想到找個地方避雨，但是頑固的真里亞不會為這點事屈服。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看来，似乎是有某位好心人拿了把伞给她。{n}一般的小孩若是碰到下雨，多半都会想到找个地方避雨，但是顽固的真里亚不会为这点事屈服。
Indonesian (IDN): Pasti ada seseorang yang baik hati yang membawakannya payung. Anak biasa mungkin akan langsung mencari tempat berteduh saat hujan mulai turun, tapi Maria terlalu keras kepala untuk menyerah semudah itu.
Italian (IT): Sembrava che qualche persona premurosa le avesse portato un ombrello. In caso di pioggia, una ragazzina normale avrebbe pensato a trovare riparo, ma Maria era troppo testarda per arrendersi così facilmente...
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre yardımsever biri ona bir şemsiye getirmişti.{n}Normal bir kız yağmur yağmaya başladığında sığınacak bir yer arardı ama Maria'nın inadının böyle bir şeyle kırılmasına imkan yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...So maybe that person gave up recommending that she find shelter, and at least brought an umbrella for her.
Steam (ST): ...So, maybe that caring person gave up on telling Maria to find shelter, then decided to at least give her an umbrella.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...So maybe that person gave up recommending that she find shelter, and at least had her take an umbrella.

Russian (RU): ...Поэтому тот человек отчаялся убедить её укрыться от дождя и решил хотя бы оставить ей зонтик.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Talvez a pessoa tenha desistido de dizer para ela se abrigar, e então trouxe ao menos um guarda‐chuva.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …也正因如此，那位好心人才会放弃劝她去避雨，而去给她拿了把伞吧。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Jadi, mungkin orang baik hati itu menyerah membujuk Maria untuk berteduh, dan memutuskan untuk setidaknya memberinya payung.
Italian (IT): Quindi, forse quella persona aveva rinunciato a raccomandarle di cercare un riparo, e le aveva quantomeno portato un ombrello.
Turkish (TR): ...Belki de o kişi sığınacak bir yer bulmasını tavsiye etmekten vazgeçmiş ve en azından ona bir şemsiye getirmişti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Father. Please at least join us for dinner. It won't be a family conference like this."
Steam (ST): "Father, please at least join us for dinner. It won't be a family conference otherwise."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): Apparently, Kinzo was completely focused on the final battle of his long‐lasting chess match with Nanjo.
Steam (ST): Apparently, Kinzo was completely focused on the final battle of his long-lasting chess match with Nanjo.

Umineko Project (UP): His brow wrinkled, he continued to glare at the game board through his spectacles; Krauss's voice didn't reach his ears.

Steam (ST): ".........Kinzo-san, I'm hungry myself. Why don't we go down and eat?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, you can go by yourself. Let me consider this next move for a little longer. ...We are going to finish it tonight."
Steam (ST): "Go by yourself if that's what you want. Let me consider this next move for a little longer. ...We are going to finish it tonight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In that case, you can go by yourself. Let me consider this next move for a little longer. ...We are going to finish it tonight.
PC Japanese (JP): 「ならばお前だけで行くといい。私はもうしばらく、この一手を吟味させてもらうぞ。…今夜で決着をつけてやる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ならばお前だけで行くといい。私はもうしばらく、この一手を吟味させてもらうぞ。…今夜で決着をつけてやる」
Russian (RU): "В таком случае ступай, если хочешь. Мне ещё нужно время, чтобы обдумать следующий ход. ...Мы должны закончить эту партию сегодня."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nesse caso, você pode ir sozinho. Me deixe pensar mais um pouco no próximo movimento. ...Nós vamos terminar isto esta noite."

Indonesian (IDN): "Pergilah sendiri kalau kau mau. Biarkan aku memikirkan langkah selanjutnya sedikit lebih lama. ...Kita akan menyelesaikannya malam ini.
Italian (IT): "Allora puoi andarci da solo. Lasciami considerare la mia mossa per un altro po'... Stanotte la finiremo..."
Turkish (TR): "Bu durumda, tek başına gidebilirsin. Bir sonraki hamleyi biraz daha düşüneyim. ...Bu gece bitireceğiz."

Umineko Project (UP): "............Otherwise, it looks like this match will never in eternity be settled."

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo stood from his seat, hoping this would prompt Kinzo to do the same, but Kinzo's eyes never left the chessboard.
Steam (ST): Nanjo rose from his seat, hoping this would prompt Kinzo do the same, but Kinzo's eyes never left the chessboard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo stood from his seat, hoping this would prompt Kinzo do the same, but Kinzo's eyes never left the chessboard.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條は自ら席を立ち、金蔵にも同じように席を立つよう促したつもりだったが、それでも金蔵の目がチェス盤から離れることはなかった。
Russian (RU): Нанджо встал со своего места, надеясь, что побудит этим Кинзо последовать его примеру, но глаза Кинзо не отрывались от шахматной доски.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nanjo levantou de seu assento, esperando que Kinzo prontamente fizesse o mesmo, mas Kinzo não tirou os olhos do tabuleiro.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条从坐椅上站了起来，想要以此催促金藏也一同离席，但是金藏的眼睛只是盯着棋盘不为所动。

Umineko Project (UP): He knew well that Kinzo always displayed a blind concentration when it came to chess, but he had never seen Kinzo as focused as he was now.
Steam (ST): He knew well that Kinzo always displayed a blind concentration when it came to chess, but he'd never seen Kinzo concentrate as hard as this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He knew well that Kinzo always displayed a blind concentration when it came to chess, but he had never seen Kinzo as concentrated as he was now.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵がチェスに対し、いつも盲目的な集中力を見せることは常々知っていたが、それでも今夜の集中力はこれまでとは比べ物にならないものだった。
Russian (RU): Нанджо хорошо знал, что Кинзо всегда целиком концентрируется на игре, когда они играют в шахматы, но он ещё не видел, чтобы Кинзо был настолько погружён в игру, как в этот раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele sabia bem que Kinzo demonstrava uma cega concentração quando se tratava de xadrez, mas ele nunca havia visto Kinzo tão focado como agora.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏对国际象棋总是会展现出一副忘我的执着，这一点南条早就心知肚明，但是今晚的执着根本和平常的没法比。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia tahu betul bahwa Kinzo selalu menunjukkan konsentrasi membabi buta saat bermain catur, tapi dia belum pernah melihat Kinzo berkonsentrasi sekeras ini.

Umineko Project (UP): ...He was acting almost as though—just as he had said—if the game wasn't finished tonight, there would never be another chance for them to continue their contest...
Steam (ST): ...It was almost as though Kinzo was telling the truth, and there would never be another chance for them to continue their contest if they didn't finish tonight...

Chinese Simplified (CN): …就如他自己所言，这份执着简直就像是在诉说着，今晚不决出胜负的话这盘棋就再也没机会分出胜负似的…。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Rasanya hampir seperti Kinzo berkata jujur, bahwa takkan ada kesempatan lagi melanjutkan pertandingan ini jika tidak diselesaikan malam ini...
Italian (IT): Con quelle parole era come se stesse dicendo che, nel caso la partita non fosse finita quella sera, non avrebbero avuto un'altra occasione per scoprire chi sarebbe stato il vincitore...
Turkish (TR): ...Sanki—tıpkı söylediği gibi—bu gece oyun sonuçlanmazsa, oyunlarına devam etmeleri için bir daha asla şansları olmayacakmış gibi davranıyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): Further attempts to persistently call him would surely not reach his heart.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...............Me desculpe, eu não pude fazer nada... ...O mundo do Kinzo‐san não é nada além deste quarto agora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……………沒能幫上忙真是抱歉…。…現在金藏先生的世界，就只有這個房間而已。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……………没能帮上忙真是抱歉…。…现在金藏先生的世界，就只有这个房间而已。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Maaf, aku tak bisa membantumu... ...Saat ini, ruangan ini adalah seluruh dunia bagi Kinzo-san."
Italian (IT): "...Mi spiace di non poter esservi d'aiuto... Al momento, il mondo di Kinzo-san consiste solo nella sua stanza."
Turkish (TR): "...............Yardımcı olamadığım için üzgünüm... ...Kinzo-san'ın dünyası artık bu odadan başka bir şey değil."

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo shook his head with a completely defeated expression.{n}Krauss raised his fist once more and banged on the door, shouting.
Steam (ST): Nanjo shook his head with a completely defeated expression. Krauss raised his fist once more and banged on the door, shouting.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo shook his head with a completely defeated expression. Krauss raised his fist once more and banged on the door, shouting.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條は諦めきった表情で首を横に振る。蔵臼はもう一度拳を振り上げ、扉を叩きながら怒鳴った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 南條は諦めきった表情で首を横に振る。{n}蔵臼はもう一度拳を振り上げ、扉を叩きながら怒鳴った。
Russian (RU): Нанджо опустил голову с выражением полного поражения.{n}Краусс снова поднял кулак и забарабанил в дверь, прокричав:
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nanjo balançou a cabeça com uma expressão completamente derrotada.{n}Krauss levantou seu punho e, mais uma vez, bateu na porta, gritando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條擺出無奈的表情搖了搖頭。{n}藏臼又舉起了拳頭，一邊敲著門一邊大聲喊道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条摆出无奈的表情摇了摇头。{n}藏臼又举起了拳头，一边敲着门一边大声喊道。
Indonesian (IDN): Nanjo menggelengkan kepalanya dengan ekspresi yang sepenuhnya kalah. Krauss kembali mengangkat kepalan tangannya dan mengetuk pintu dengan keras, sambil berteriak.
Italian (IT): Nanjo scosse la testa con un'espressione rassegnata. Klaus alzò ancora una volta il pugno e colpì la porta, urlando.
Turkish (TR): Nanjo tamamen yenilmiş bir ifadeyle başını salladı.{n}Krauss yumruğunu bir kez daha kaldırdı ve bağırarak kapıya vurdu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "......Father, can you hear me?! We are heading down now, but any time you feel like it, please join us. All of your children are waiting for you...!"
Steam (ST): "......Father, can you hear me?! We're heading down now, but please join us any time you feel like it. All of your children are waiting for you...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お父さん、聞こえますか！　私たちは下へ降りますが、気が向かれたらいつでもおいで下さい。息子兄弟一同、ずっとお待ちしておりますよ…！」
Russian (RU): "......Отец, ты меня слышишь?! Сейчас мы идём вниз, но если захочешь, пожалуйста, присоединяйся к нам. Все твои дети ждут тебя!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Pai, você consegue me ouvir?! Nós estamos descendo agora, mas, por favor, junte‐se a nós na hora em que preferir. Todos os seus filhos estão esperando por você...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……爸，聽得到嗎！我們先下去了，不過您什麼時候要是轉變心意了就請下來吧。我們兄妹幾個會一直等著您的…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……爸，听得到吗！我们先下去了，不过您什么时候要是转变心意了就请下来吧。我们兄妹几个会一直等着您的…！」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Ayah, bisa kau mendengarku?! Kami akan turun sekarang, tapi tolong ikutlah kapan pun kau mau. Semua anakmu sedang menunggumu...!"
Italian (IT): "...Padre, riesci a sentirmi?! Noi stiamo scendendo, ma se te la senti, vieni pure quando vuoi, per favore. Tutti i tuoi figli ti stanno aspettando...!"
Turkish (TR): "......Baba, beni duyuyor musun?! Şimdi aşağı iniyoruz, ama ne zaman istersen lütfen bize katıl. Bütün çocukların seni bekliyor...!"

Umineko Project (UP): The voice was very loud, and the door was being noisily pounded on.{n}There was no way that it wouldn't reach Kinzo's ears.
Steam (ST): His voice was very loud, and he was making a racket pounding on the door. There was no way it wouldn't reach Kinzo's ears.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The voice was very loud, and the door was being noisily pounded on. There was no way that it wouldn't reach Kinzo's ears.
PC Japanese (JP): これだけ大声を出し、騒々しく扉を叩いているのだ。金蔵の耳にまったく届かないはずはない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): これだけ大声を出し、騒々しく扉を叩いているのだ。{n}金蔵の耳にまったく届かないはずはない。
Russian (RU): Голос был очень громким, и стук в дверь был очень шумным.{n}Кинзо не мог не услышать их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A voz estava bem elevada, assim como o som das batidas na porta.{n}Não havia como o som não chegar aos ouvidos de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 叫喊聲是如此之大，敲門聲是如此之響。{n}不可能一點都沒傳到金藏耳朵裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 叫喊声是如此之大，敲门声是如此之响。{n}不可能一点都没传到金藏耳朵里。
Indonesian (IDN): Suaranya sangat keras, dan dia membuat keributan saat mengetuk pintu. Tak mungkin Kinzo tidak mendengarnya.
Italian (IT): La voce era molto forte, e il suo bussare stava facendo un gran fracasso.{n}Era impossibile che non stesse arrivando alle orecchie di Kinzo...
Turkish (TR): Ses çok yüksekti ve kapıya gürültülü bir şekilde vuruluyordu.{n}Kinzo'nun kulaklarına ulaşmaması mümkün değildi.

Umineko Project (UP): ............It was reaching him.{n}However, he was ignoring it anyway.
Steam (ST): ............Well, it certainly was reaching him. But he ignored it anyway.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............It was reaching him. However, he ignored it anyway.
PC Japanese (JP): …………届いてはいるのだ。しかし、届いていて無視をしているのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …………届いてはいるのだ。{n}しかし、届いていて無視をしているのだ。
Russian (RU): ............Они достигли его ушей.{n}Однако он проигнорировал их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Ele chegou até ele.{n}No entanto, ele ignorou mesmo assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………其實是傳到了。{n}但金藏對此充耳不聞，不理不睬。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………其实是传到了。{n}但金藏对此充耳不闻，不理不睬。
Indonesian (IDN): ............Yah, sebenarnya dia pasti mendengarnya. Tapi dia tetap mengabaikannya.
Italian (IT): E infatti la sentì. Ma lui la ignorò comunque.
Turkish (TR): ............Ona ulaşıyordu.{n}Ancak, yine de görmezden geliyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): However, unlike the time he was being called down for lunch, he did not get into a rage.{n}......Kinzo was now simply calm at heart, ...and it was almost as though he had attained peace by turning himself over to fate.
Steam (ST): However, unlike the time he'd been called down for lunch, he didn't fly into a rage. ......By now, Kinzo was calm at heart, ...almost as though he had taken on a philosophical view and turned himself over to fate.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, unlike the time he was being called down for lunch, he did not get into a rage.......Kinzo was now simply calm at heart, ...it was almost as though he had gained a far-sightedness by turning himself over to fate.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、昼に呼ばれた時のように激昂はしない。……今の金蔵はただひたすらに心穏やかで、…それはまるで、運命に身を任せるかのような達観すら感じられた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、昼に呼ばれた時のように激昂はしない。{n}……今の金蔵はただひたすらに心穏やかで、…それはまるで、運命に身を任せるかのような達観すら感じられた。
Russian (RU): В отличие от прошлых случаев, когда его приглашали присоединиться к трапезе, он не стал впадать в ярость.{n}......Теперь на сердце у Кинзо было спокойно... Это было сродни тому, как если бы он получил дар предвидения, вверившись судьбе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, diferente da hora em que ele foi chamado para o almoço, ele não se enfureceu.{n}......Kinzo estava agora com o coração calmo, ...era quase como se ele tivesse alcançado a paz ao se entregar para o destino.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過金藏沒有像中午被吵到的時候那樣激動起來。{n}……現在的金藏只顧保持心境平和，…讓人感覺簡直像是把自己交由命運擺佈，達到了悟道的境界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过金藏没有像中午被吵到的时候那样激动起来。{n}……现在的金藏只顾保持心境平和，…让人感觉简直像是把自己交由命运摆布，达到了悟道的境界。
Indonesian (IDN): Namun, berbeda dengan saat dia dipanggil makan siang, kali ini dia tidak meledak dalam amarah. ......Kini, hati Kinzo tenang, ...seolah dia telah menerima segalanya secara filosofis dan menyerahkan diri pada takdir.
Italian (IT): Però non si arrabbiò come quando venne chiamato per pranzo... Nel cuore di Kinzo vi era soltanto la pace... era quasi come se, abbandonandosi al suo destino, avesse ottenuto un senso di lungimiranza.
Turkish (TR): Bununla birlikte, öğle yemeği için aşağı çağrıldığı zamanın aksine, öfkelenmedi.{n}......Kinzo'nun kalbi artık sadece sakindi, ...ve sanki kendini kadere teslim ederek huzura kavuşmuş gibiydi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "......I am not interested in dinner, nor in my sons' faces. ............I will only leave here when {f:5:Beatrice} is resurrected or when I am chosen as a sacrifice for the key... The Demons' Roulette has already started spinning. What meaning does dinner have at this point........."
Steam (ST): "Neither dinner nor the faces of my children interest me in the slightest. ......I will only leave here if {f:5:Beatrice} is resurrected, or if I am chosen as a sacrifice for the key. The Demons' Roulette has already started spinning. What meaning does dinner have at this point......?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I'm not interested even in dinner, even in my sons' faces. ............I will only leave here when Beatrice is resurrected or when I am chosen as a sacrifice for the key. The Demons' Roulette has already started spinning. What meaning does dinner have at this point........."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……晩餐にも、息子たちの顔にも興味はない。…………私がここを出るのは、ベアトリーチェが蘇る時か、私が鍵の生贄に選ばれた時だけだ…。もう悪魔のルーレットは回っている。今さら晩餐に何の意味があろう………。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……晩餐にも、息子たちの顔にも興味はない。…………私がここを出るのは、ベアトリーチェが蘇る時か、私が鍵の生贄に選ばれた時だけだ…。もう悪魔のルーレットは回っている。今さら晩餐に何の意味があろう………」
Russian (RU): "Меня не волнует ужин и даже лица моих сыновей. ............Я уйду отсюда лишь тогда, когда воскреснет {f:5:Беатриче} или же когда меня выберут жертвой для ключа. Рулетка демонов уже начала вращаться. Какой сейчас смысл чревоугодничать..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu não estou interessado no jantar, muito menos no rosto dos meus filhos. ............Eu só sairei daqui quando a {f:5:Beatrice} reviver ou quando eu for escolhido como sacrifício pela chave... A Roleta dos Demônios já começou a girar. O que significa que jantar nesse momento........."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……晚餐也好，和兒女們見面也好，我全都沒興趣。…………我從這兒出去的時候，只有貝阿朵莉切復甦之時，或我被鑰匙選中成為活祭之時…。惡魔的輪盤賭已經開始轉起來了。事到如今晚餐還有什麼意義………」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……晚餐也好，和儿女们见面也好，我全都没兴趣。…………我从这儿出去的时候，只有贝阿朵莉切复苏之时，或我被钥匙选中成为活祭之时…。恶魔的轮盘赌已经开始转起来了。事到如今晚餐还有什么意义………」
Indonesian (IDN): "Makan malam maupun wajah anak-anakku sama sekali tidak menarik bagiku. ......Aku hanya akan keluar dari sini jika {f:5:Beatrice} dibangkitkan, atau jika aku terpilih sebagai korban untuk kunci. Rolet Iblis sudah mulai berputar. Apa arti makan malam di titik ini......?"
Italian (IT): "Non ho alcun interesse nella cena, e nemmeno di vedere i volti dei miei figli... Lascerò questo luogo solo quando {f:5:Beatrice} resusciterà, o se verrò scelto come sacrificio per la chiave... La Roulette Demoniaca sta già girando. Che importanza potrebbe mai avere adesso la cena...?"
Turkish (TR): "......Ben ne yemekle ne de oğullarımın yüzüyle ilgileniyorum. ............Burayı ancak {f:5:Beatrice} dirildiğinde ya da anahtar için kurban olarak seçildiğimde terk edeceğim... İblislerin Ruleti çoktan dönmeye başladı. Bu noktada akşam yemeğinin ne anlamı var ki........."

Umineko Project (UP): As though the painfully loud banging on the door had completely failed to enter his hearing,{n}Kinzo, in a state of total peace, silently thought about his next chess move...
Steam (ST): As though the painfully loud banging on the door completely failed to enter his hearing... ...Kinzo silently thought about his next chess move, still in his philosophical state...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Acting as though the painfully loud banging on the door completely failed to enter his hearing......and still in his philosophic state, Kinzo silently thought about his next chess move...
PC Japanese (JP): 耳障りな扉を叩く音などまるで耳に入らぬかのように。…金蔵は達観の境地でチェスの一手に黙考するのだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 耳障りな扉を叩く音などまるで耳に入らぬかのように。{n}…金蔵は達観の境地でチェスの一手に黙考するのだった…。
Russian (RU): Такие помехи, как раздражающе громкий стук в дверь, не могли потревожить его слух...{n}И, пребывая в своих философских рассуждениях, Кинзо молча обдумывал свой следующий шахматный ход...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se as fortes batidas na porta tivessem falhado completamente em chegar aos seus ouvidos, Kinzo, em um estado de paz, silenciosamente pensava sobre o seu próximo movimento...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 刺耳的敲門聲簡直像沒傳入耳中一樣。{n}…金藏以悟道的心境默默思考著下一步棋…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刺耳的敲门声简直像没传入耳中一样。{n}…金藏以悟道的心境默默思考着下一步棋…。
Indonesian (IDN): Seolah suara gedukan pintu yang menyakitkan telinga itu sama sekali tak masuk ke pendengarannya... ...Kinzo diam-diam memikirkan langkah catur berikutnya, tetap dalam keadaan pikirannya yang filosofis...
Italian (IT): Era come se il rumore irritante dei colpi alla porta non riuscisse a stimolare il suo udito... Kinzo era in uno stato riflessivo, contemplando in silenzio la sua prossima mossa di scacchi...
Turkish (TR): Kinzo sanki kapıya vurulan gürültüyü duymamış gibi,tam bir huzur içinde, sessizce bir sonraki satranç hamlesini düşünüyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): Just as always, Kinzo was the only one missing from the dining hall.{n}Krauss, wearing a bitter smile, returned with Nanjo.
Steam (ST): Just as always, Kinzo's figure couldn't be seen anywhere in the dining hall. Krauss, wearing a bitter smile, returned with Nanjo.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just as always, Kinzo's figure could not be seen anywhere in the dining hall. Krauss, wearing a bitter smile, returned with Nanjo.
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂には相変わらず、金蔵の姿だけがなかった。蔵臼が苦笑いを浮かべながら、南條と戻ってくる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 食堂には相変わらず、金蔵の姿だけがなかった。{n}蔵臼が苦笑いを浮かべながら、南條と戻ってくる。
Russian (RU): Как обычно, Кинзо отсутствовал в обеденном зале.{n}Краусс, с горькой улыбкой на лице, вернулся вместе с Нанджо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como sempre, Kinzo era o único que não estava presente na sala de jantar.{n}Krauss, com um sorriso amargo, retornou junto a Nanjo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 餐廳還是老樣子，只少了一個金藏。{n}藏臼苦笑著和南條一起回來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 餐厅还是老样子，只少了一个金藏。{n}藏臼苦笑着和南条一起回来了。
Indonesian (IDN): Seperti biasa, sosok Kinzo tak terlihat di ruang makan. Krauss, dengan senyum pahit di wajahnya, kembali bersama Nanjo.
Italian (IT): Come sempre, Kinzo era l'unica figura mancante nella sala da pranzo. Klaus, che sfoggiava un sorriso amaro, ritornò con Nanjo.
Turkish (TR): Her zaman olduğu gibi, yemek salonunda eksik olan tek kişi Kinzo'ydu.{n}Krauss, acı bir gülümsemeyle Nanjo'yla birlikte geri döndü.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Just as always, Father is not feeling well. He truly regrets missing this once‐a‐year opportunity to sit together with his gathered relatives."
Steam (ST): "Father says he still is not feeling well. He truly regrets missing this once-a-year opportunity to sit together with his gathered family."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Just as always, Father is not feeling well. He truly regrets missing this once-a-year opportunity to sit together with his gathered relatives."
PC Japanese (JP): 「親父殿は相変わらずご気分が優れられないそうだ。年に一度の、親族が集まるこの機会に同席できないことを、非常に残念がられておられた。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「親父殿は相変わらずご気分が優れられないそうだ。年に一度の、親族が集まるこの機会に同席できないことを、非常に残念がられておられた」
Russian (RU): "Как и всегда, отец себя плохо чувствует. Он выражает свои сожаления, что упускает возможность ещё на один год разделить компанию со всеми своими собравшимися здесь родственниками."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como de costume, nosso pai não está se sentindo muito bem. Ele realmente lamenta essa oportunidade que só acontece uma vez ao ano de sentar à mesa junto com sua família."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「父親依然身體欠佳。難得一年一次親戚們有機會聚在一起，不能和大家一起共進晚餐，父親為此感到非常遺憾。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「父亲依然身体欠佳。难得一年一次亲戚们有机会聚在一起，不能和大家一起共进晚餐，父亲为此感到非常遗憾。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Ayah bilang beliau masih kurang sehat. Beliau sangat menyesal melewatkan kesempatan duduk bersama keluarga yang berkumpul setahun sekali ini."
Italian (IT): "Come al solito, pare che nostro padre non si senta bene. È davvero dispiaciuto di non poter presenziare a questa occasione annuale, in cui la famiglia è riunita."
Turkish (TR): "Her zaman olduğu gibi, babam kendini iyi hissetmiyor. Yılda bir kez bir araya gelen akrabalarıyla birlikte oturma fırsatını kaçırdığı için çok üzgün."

Umineko Project (UP): Eva and Rudolf snickered.
Steam (ST): Eva and Rudolf sniggered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva and Rudolf sniggered.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽と留弗夫が失笑する。
Russian (RU): Ева и Рудольф прыснули.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eva e Rudolf deram uma leve risada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽和留弗夫不禁笑出聲來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽和留弗夫不禁笑出声来。
Indonesian (IDN): Eva dan Rudolf terkekeh.
Italian (IT): Eva e Rudolf sogghignarono.
Turkish (TR): Eva ve Rudolf kıs kıs güldüler.

Umineko Project (UP): Judging by Kinzo's character, he didn't regret it at all, ...and none of his relatives regretted that he hadn't appeared either.
Steam (ST): Given Kinzo's personality, there was no way he'd show signs of regret, ...and none of his relatives showed any regret at his absence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Judging by Kinzo's character, he didn't regret it at all. ...and none of his relatives regretted that he hadn't appeared either.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵の性分からして、残念がるわけもないし、…そして、この席に現れないことを残念がる親類もいなかったからだ。
Russian (RU): Зная характер Кинзо, тот нисколько об этом не жалел. ...И, разумеется, ни один из его родственников также не жалел, что он не явился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Julgando pela personalidade de Kinzo, ele não lamenta nem um pouco, ...e nenhum de seus filhos lamenta por ele não ter aparecido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以金藏的性格，根本不可能會感到遺憾，…而且，為他沒能出席而感到遺憾的親戚也是一個都沒有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以金藏的性格，根本不可能会感到遗憾，…而且，为他没能出席而感到遗憾的亲戚也是一个都没有。
Indonesian (IDN): Mengingat kepribadian Kinzo, tak mungkin dia menunjukkan tanda-tanda penyesalan, ...dan tak ada satu pun kerabat yang tampak menyesali ketidakhadirannya.
Italian (IT): Conoscendo l'indole di Kinzo, non gli dispiaceva affatto... e nessuno dei suoi parenti rimpianse la sua assenza.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Then why don't we start dinner. Gohda, get it started."
Steam (ST): "Then why don't we start dinner? Gohda, begin."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then why don't we start dinner. Gohda, begin."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ではディナーを始めようじゃないか。郷田、始めたまえ」

Turkish (TR): "O zaman neden yemeğe başlamıyoruz? Gohda, başlayalım."

Umineko Project (UP): "Certainly. Well then, ladies and gentlemen, we shall begin."
Steam (ST): "Certainly. Well then, if you will allow me..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Certainly. Well then, let me begin."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「遵命。这就开始上菜。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Baik. Kalau begitu, mohon izinkan saya..."
Italian (IT): "Come desidera. In tal caso, permettetemi di iniziare..."
Turkish (TR): "Elbette. Pekala, bayanlar ve baylar, başlayalım."

Umineko Project (UP): Upon finally being told to begin the family conference dinner, his highlight scene for the whole year, Gohda nodded, grinning broadly.
Steam (ST): When Gohda was told to start the family conference dinner, his biggest time to shine of the whole year, he nodded with a broad grin.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Gohda was told to begin the family conference dinner, his highlight scene for the whole year, he nodded, grinning broadly.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は、年間を通しての見せ場のひとつである親族会議の晩餐の開始をようやく告げられ、満面の笑みで頷いた。
Russian (RU): Когда Годе было приказано подать ужин семейному собранию, поручение, где он мог представить себя во всей красе, он кивнул, широко улыбаясь.

Umineko Project (UP): When Rosa timidly cut through the silence of the dining hall, everyone there turned their attention to her at once.
Steam (ST): When Rosa timidly cut through the silence of the dining hall, everyone noticed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Rosa timidly cut through the silence of the dining hall, everyone in the dining hall noticed.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Rosa timidamente cortou o silêncio na sala de jantar, todos direcionaram suas atenções para ela.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "Umm...... It started raining while Maria was in the rose garden a short while back... It seems she borrowed a white umbrella from someone, and I wanted to thank them..."
Steam (ST): "Umm, ...a short while back, Maria was in the rose garden when it started raining, and she apparently borrowed a white umbrella from someone. I wanted to thank them..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Umm...... A short while back, when Maria was in the rose garden and it started raining... it seems she borrowed a white umbrella from someone, and I wanted to thank them..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「その……。さっき、真里亞が薔薇庭園にいた時に雨が降り出して…。誰かに白い傘を借りたみたいなんだけど、お礼が言いたくて…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その……。さっき、真里亞が薔薇庭園にいた時に雨が降り出して…。誰かに白い傘を借りたみたいなんだけど、お礼が言いたくて…」
Russian (RU): "М‐м... Совсем недавно, когда Мария была в розарии и пошёл дождь... Похоже, что кто‐то одолжил ей белый зонтик, и я хотела бы поблагодарить этого человека..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem...... Começou a chover quando a Maria ainda estava no jardim de rosas pouco tempo atrás... Parece que ela pegou um guarda‐chuva branco emprestado de alguém, então eu queria agradecer..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個……。剛才真里亞在玫瑰庭園時，下起了雨…。後來不知道哪位借給了她一把白色的傘，我想為這道聲謝…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个……。刚才真里亚在玫瑰庭园时，下起了雨…。后来不知道哪位借给了她一把白色的伞，我想为这道声谢…」
Indonesian (IDN): "Umm, ...beberapa waktu lalu, Maria ada di taman mawar saat hujan mulai turun, dan katanya dia meminjam payung putih dari seseorang. Aku ingin mengucapkan terima kasih pada orang itu..."
Italian (IT): "Ecco... Poco fa, quando Maria era nel roseto, iniziò a piovere... e sembra che abbia preso in prestito un ombrello bianco da qualcuno. Volevo ringraziare questa persona..."
Turkish (TR): "Umm...... Maria kısa bir süre önce gül bahçesindeyken yağmur yağmaya başladı... Görünüşe göre birinden beyaz bir şemsiye ödünç almış ve ben de ona teşekkür etmek istedim..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "It wasn't one of us. After you went out, Rosa, we changed rooms and continued our "friendly" chat the whole rest of the time."
Steam (ST): "It wasn't one of us. After you left, we moved to a different room and had a "friendly" chat that whole time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It wasn't one of us. After you went out, Rosa, we moved over to our room and had a 'friendly' chat the whole time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺たちじゃねぇぜ。楼座が出てった後は、部屋を移してずっと“仲良く”おしゃべりをしてたからなぁ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「俺たちじゃねぇぜ。楼座が出てった後は、部屋を移してずっと“仲良く”おしゃべりをしてたからなぁ」
Russian (RU): "Это точно не был один из нас. После того, как Роза вышла, мы отправились в нашу комнату, где всё это время занимались 'дружеским' разговором."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não foi nenhum de nós. Depois que você saiu, Rosa, nós mudamos de sala e continuamos a nossa "amigável" conversa durante todo o tempo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不是我們。因為樓座出去後，我們可是換了個房間一直在“友好”地聊天啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不是我们。因为楼座出去后，我们可是换了个房间一直在“友好”地聊天啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Itu bukan salah satu dari kami. Setelah kau pergi, kami pindah ke ruangan lain dan mengadakan obrolan “akrab” sepanjang waktu."
Italian (IT): "Non è stato uno di noi. Dopo che sei uscita, ci siamo spostati in un'altra stanza e abbiamo continuato ad avere una discussione ‘amichevole’."
Turkish (TR): "Bizden biri değildi. Rosa, sen dışarı çıktıktan sonra odamızı değiştirdik ve geri kalan tüm zaman boyunca "dostça" sohbetimize devam ettik."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "Haha, ...that's right. Even after that, us siblings kept on with our friendly chat."
Steam (ST): "Haha, ...that's right. Even after that, the siblings had a real friendly chat."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Haha, ...that's right. After that, the siblings had a real friendly chat."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「はは、…そうやで。あの後も兄弟で仲良くおしゃべりをしとったのや」
Russian (RU): "Ха‐ха... Это верно. После этого между братьями и сёстрами состоялась дружеская беседа."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哈哈，…是呐。那之后几兄妹也都聊得很友好呐。」

Umineko Project (UP): The word friendly fell awkwardly from Hideyoshi's lips, so that even those that hadn't been there realized that it hadn't been a pleasant conversation.
Steam (ST): The word "friendly" fell awkwardly from Hideyoshi's lips, so even those who hadn't been present could tell the conversation hadn't been a pleasant one.

PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉の仲良くという言葉にはかなりの違和感があり、その場に居合わせなかった人間でも、さぞや不愉快な会話だったのだろうと察しがついた。
Russian (RU): Слово "дружеская" прозвучало из уст Хидэёши как‐то натянуто, поэтому даже те, кто не присутствовал там, поняли, что это был неприятный разговор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A palavra amigável saiu de forma estranha dos lábios de Hideyoshi, de forma que mesmo aqueles que não estavam lá podiam perceber que não tinha sido uma conversa agradável.

Indonesian (IDN): Kata “akrab” terdengar canggung dari mulut Hideyoshi, jadi bahkan mereka yang tidak ikut pun tahu bahwa pembicaraannya tidak menyenangkan.
Italian (IT): Dalle labbra di Hideyoshi la parola ‘amichevole’ suonava goffa, e così, anche chi non era presente alla conversazione potè supporre che di certo non era stata piacevole.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "Nii‐san went up to the study with Genji‐san to call Father. At that time, the rest of us went straight to the dining hall. So it wasn't one of us. ...For a consideration like lending an umbrella, wouldn't it be one of the servants?"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Nii-san went up to the study with Genji-san to call Father. At that time, the rest of us went straight to the dining hall. So it wasn't one of us. ...Couldn't it have been a servant kind enough to lend an umbrella?"

Russian (RU): "Нии‐сан пошёл в кабинет вместе с Генджи‐саном, чтобы позвать отца. В это время все остальные направились прямиком в обеденный зал. Поэтому это точно не мог быть один из нас. ...Может быть, кто‐то из слуг оказался так любезен, чтобы отдать свой зонт?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O nii‐san subiu para o estúdio junto com o Genji‐san para chamar o pai. Durante este tempo, o resto de nós foi diretamente para a sala de jantar. Então não pode ter sido nenhum de nós. ...Pela consideração de ter emprestado um guarda‐chuva, não poderia ter sido algum dos serviçais?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哥和源次一起去楼上书房叫爸。我们就直接来餐厅了。所以不是我们哦。…借伞的好心人，大概是佣人中的谁吧？」
Indonesian (IDN): "Nii-san naik ke ruang kerja bersama Genji-san untuk memanggil Ayah. Waktu itu, kami langsung menuju ruang makan. Jadi itu bukan dari kami. ...Bukankah mungkin salah satu pelayan yang cukup baik hati untuk meminjamkan payung?"

Turkish (TR): "Evet. Madam'dan emri aldığımızda ben, Kumasawa-san ve Kanon-kun odaları hazırlıyorduk. ...Sonra akşam yemeği vakti geldi ve Genji-sama'dan konukevine gidip çocukları çağırmamız için bir emir aldık, Kanon-kun bizim adımıza gitti."

Umineko Project (UP): Krauss was laughing with a face that was clearly mocking her, but Maria, apparently feeling that her claim was being believed, was overjoyed.

PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼は明らかに馬鹿にした表情で笑うが、真里亞は自分の主張を信じてくれたように感じたらしく、非常に満足げに喜ぶのだった。
